titleInfo.title: Meat Kitchen at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 7 x 9 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#454 JCRS Kitchen''. On back of photograph: ''#454 JCRS Kosher Kitchen, meat region''.

mods.abstract: Two unidentified men in the meat kitchen of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
